intro: Cardamine keysseri, commonly known as the Keyser’s watercress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a peppery scent when crushed. The small white flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring.
